text: Constantine VII Porphyrogennetos or Porphyrogenitus, "the Purple-born" (), (September 2, 905 â€“ November 9, 959) was the son of the Byzantine emperor Leo VI and his fourth wife Zoe Karbonopsina. He was also the nephew of the Emperor Alexander. He wrote two descriptive books, De Administrando Imperio and De Ceremoniis. ==Other websites== Category:905 births Category:959 deaths Category:Byzantine emperors Category:Ottoman writers
title: Constantine VII
